dlgPart.npc_text: “What’re you looking at?” demands a rough-looking man standing near the gates. His beaten bronze armor suggests that its owner hasn’t done well for himself.

dlgAnsw.text: “I haven’t seen many mercenaries around here.”
Ignore him and walk away.

dlgPart.npc_text: “Gods be with you, <brother/sister>,” says the mercenary.

dlgAnsw.text: [streetwise success]“Your faith is strong, brother. That’s why the Gods have chosen you above all others.”
Leave.
“I was just curious what brought you here, brother.”
Leave him alone.

dlgPart.npc_text: “I came to fight,” says the man, “to offer my sword in defense of the Holy City.”

dlgAnsw.text: “What made you a believer?”

dlgPart.npc_text:
“A raider ran me through with a spear. I raised my shield in time, but the spear went through it like it wasn’t there. I thought I was a goner for sure but the caravan master dropped me off at some village and their wise woman managed to bring me back with her herbs and potions.
“She was the one who told me all about Brother Meru and his teachings. It took me weeks to recover, so I just lay there and listened, thinking to myself that if the Gods give me a second chance, I’ll go to Ganezzar and pledge my sword to Meru.
“Well, here I am. I didn’t see Meru yet, but I guess he’s just busy.”

dlgAnsw.text: “What did she tell you?”

dlgPart.npc_text:
“What everyone knows,” says the man looking surprised. “That Brother Meru used to be a lord of this city but he was a kind and just lord. He saw much suffering around him and he wanted to make people’s lives better. He prayed for guidance and the Gods answered. They told him what he needs to do to bring them back.
“Brother Meru renounced his title and started teaching people devotion toward the Gods. When we’re ready, the Gods will return and establish their own Kingdom and we’ll all live by their Laws.”

dlgAnsw.text: “Amen, brother!”
“Do you really believe that?”
“Well, good luck with that.” Leave.

dlgPart.npc_text: “Of course I believe that,” says the man looking at you with suspicion. “Would I be here if I didn’t?”

dlgAnsw.text: “So you believe the Gods are somewhere out there, waiting to return and fix all this mess?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “The Gods are our shepherds, we’re their flock,” says the man, repeating someone else’s words.

dlgAnsw.text: “And where were these shepherds for the last four centuries?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “We weren’t ready. We lived in ignorance because we didn’t know any better, but now we do. Now we’re ready,” he says triumphantly.

dlgAnsw.text: [streetwise success]“Your faith is strong, brother. That’s why the Gods have chosen you above all others.”
Leave.

dlgPart.npc_text: “What are you talking about?” the mercenary asks suspiciously.

dlgAnsw.text: “The Gods came to me in a dream, brother. They told me to find you –”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Me?” interrupts the mercenary, his mouth agape.

dlgAnsw.text: “You, brother. Or is there anyone else here whose faith is as strong as yours?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “No,” the mercenary says quickly as if afraid that you'd reconsider.

dlgAnsw.text: “The Gods see all, brother. They came to me in a dream and told me to bring you to them. But...”

dlgPart.npc_text: “But what?” asks the mercenary, instantly suspicious again. “If you want money, you can forget about it.”

dlgAnsw.text: [streetwise][persuasion]“I don’t want your money, brother. The Gods want to test you, that’s all. It’s easy to talk the talk, it’s much harder to walk the walk, if you know what I mean.”

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]“Leave me alone,” the mercenary says angrily.

dlgAnsw.text: Leave.

dlgPart.npc_text: [success]“Then test me!” cries the mercenary, his eye burning with zeal.

dlgAnsw.text: “Not here, brother. Come with me.” Take him to Hellgate.

dlgPart.npc_text: The mercenary doesn't have anything else to say to you.

dlgAnsw.text: Leave.
